unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Expected Count: Orange Soda
question_text: A researcher surveyed a sample of $1{,}989\text{ people}$ . Here are the actual results of his survey on interest in orange soda: Age Range High School College 22 year olds Total Interested 256 774 115 1145 Lying but Interested 618 15 117 750 Not Interested 37 22 35 94 Total 911 811 267 1989 Under the null hypothesis that age range and orange soda interest are independent, what would be the expected count for the number of college students who are ‘Not Interested’ in orange soda given the college sample size of $811 \text{ college students}$ ?
